item.title: Wiggle Subsequence
item.description: I was solving a problem called Wiggle Subsequence on leetcode today. I spent sometime thinking of the solution to the problem before I realized that there was a similar named problem I had solved recently. Longest Increasing Subsequence. One of the solutions to the problem runs in O(n2) time. That solution calculates the longest increasing subsequence of a given index i by checking the longest increasing subsequence for all indices j < i for which nums[i] > nums[j].

item.title: First Blog
item.description: Hello all! This is my first blog. Excitied to get this ball rolling.

item.title: About
item.description: I am a Software Engineer at Cloudera, where I am part of the Internal Systems Engineering team. Specifically, I am in the Tools sub-team, where I work on developing and maintaining tools for the internal support organization. Before joining Cloudera, I worked at BlackRock briefly as a Software Engineer. There, I worked as part of the Portfolio Management team as well as Securities Lending team. Prior to joining BlackRock, I was a graduate student pursuing Masters in Computer Science at New York University.
